main event: On September 9, 1964, at approximately 7:00 p.m. CST, a bright white light was observed in the sky near Soudan, Minnesota, hovering over Lake Vermilion.
interesting points: The light was reported to be round or oval in shape and approximately 100 feet in diameter., The object remained stationary for about 5 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view., Numerous witnesses included local residents and employees of the nearby taconite mine., An Air Force investigation was conducted on-site, yet no physical evidence was found., The case was ultimately classified as 'Unidentified'.
sighted object: bright white light in the sky
witnesses: local residents and employees of the nearby taconite mine
